subject: p19731864
Findings: The heart is moderately enlarged. The aortic arch is calcified. Again noted is mild prominence of the main pulmonary artery contour in the aortopulmonary window. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. There is persistent minor atelectasis at the left lung base, but otherwise, the lungs appear clear.
Impression: No evidence of acute cardiopulmonary disease.
